com.snap2d.gl.opengl

Class GLDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.gl.opengl.GLDisplay

  • public class GLDisplay
extends Object
    A class representing a native window onto which an OpenGL context can be rendered. GLDisplay is backed internally by the JOGL NEWT windowing system.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

      • GLDisplay

        public GLDisplay(int width,
         int height,
         Display.Type type,
         GLConfig config)
        Creates this GLDisplay with the given window properties and GL configuration.
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -
        type - the window type; windowed or fullscreen
        config - GL configuration; may be null (default configuration will be used)

        Initializes this GLDisplay's input system.
        Parameters:

      • addKeyListener

        public void addKeyListener(GLKeyListener key)
        Add a GLKeyListener to this GLDisplay. NEWT KeyEvent[s] will be wrapped in a GLKeyEvent and dispatched to registered listeners. You must call initInputSystem(boolean) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        key -

      • addMouseListener

        public void addMouseListener(GLMouseListener mouse)
        Add a GLMouseListener to this GLDisplay. NEWT MouseEvent[s] will be wrapped in a GLMouseEvent and dispatched to registered listeners. You must call initInputSystem(boolean) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        mouse -

        Parameters:

      • dispose

        public void dispose(GLDisplay.GLDisposalCallback onDisposeCallback)
        Disposes of this GLDisplay and all of its internally held resources, including the current GLRenderControl. This method will create a new disposer thread to handle the cleanup process and return immediately. Once the disposer has finished releasing all resources held by the GL context, the optional GLDisposalCallback will be notified via GLDisposalCallback.onDispose.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Equivalent to GLDisplay.dispose(null)
